Esta solicitando de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, cierres y demás, para poder seguir con sus confecciones y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) communal bank is located in the Calle Poi village in the city of Paraguarí.  This group is comprised of 17 women who engage in different business activities in order to be able to have the means to help their families.  However, they also engage in activities together in order to be able to have savings that will help them in cases of necessity.  

Obdulia is part of the group.  She describes herself as a person with a great desire to get ahead and to work.  She says that her goal is to continue growing in what she does in order to continue helping her family.  Her work is sewing because she is a dressmaker.  She always has a lot of work, and this helps her to continue on and to have the means to help her family.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy fabric, thread, elastic, zippers, and the rest.  She will do this in order to be able to continue with her dressmaking and to complete her customers’ orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, zippers, and the rest.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis, es soltero y tiene un hijo que esta en etapa escolar, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando tres habitaciones pequeñas, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja en una empresa privada como empleado por más de ocho horas al día ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para compra de materiales como cemento, arena, estuco, para  la refacción del baño su casa ya que desea tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Luis is single and has a school-age child.  He lives in three small rooms in his parents' house, located in the Pampahasi area of the city of La Paz.

Currently he works as an employee in a private company for more than eight hours a day because he has to cover his family's expenses for food, education, and services.

He needs the loan to buy materials such as cement, sand, and plaster to renovate the bathroom of his house because he wants to have greater comfort and improve his quality of life.

This is the second time he has worked with IMPRO and the first with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and plaster to renovate the bathroom

loans.name: Tuzamurane Twimpara B Group

texts.fr:
Alfred (le premier à droite sur la photo) fait partie du groupe solidaire TUZAMURANE TWMPR B qui fait l’agriculture du riz. Il est marié, âgé de 32 ans et a 3 enfants dont le plus âgé a 10 ans et le moins âgé a 1 année. Un de  ses enfants va  à l’école et aucune autre personne n’est en sa charge. Il est né au Rwanda et son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de l’école primaire.
Il a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd en 2012 et est au 3ème cycle de crédit. Les cycles antérieurs sont bien remboursés.
Avec le présent crédit, Il va acheter la semence, les engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre. Il n’attend aucune difficulté de non remboursement de ce prêt.
Pour accroitre son agriculture, il a la stratégie d’améliorer son activité en la modernisant.
L’ambition pour son activité agricole est de devenir le grand cultivateur du riz dans sa région. Pour sa famille, il a l’ambition d’assurer les frais médicaux et les frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Alfred (the first on the right in the picture) is a member of the Tuzamurane Twimpara B solidarity group, which grows rice. He is 32 years old, married and has 3 children, the eldest of whom is 10 years old and the youngest, 1. One of his children attends school and he is responsible for no other people. He was born in Rwanda and has 6 years of primary school education. He started working with ACB Ltd in 2012 and is on his 3rd loan cycle. The previous loans were correctly repaid.

With this current loan, he will buy seeds and chemical fertilizers and pay the labourers. He does not expect to have any difficulties repaying this loan. His strategy to increase his agricultural production is to improve his farming business by modernising his farming techniques. His business ambition is to become the biggest rice farmer in his region. As far as his family is concerned, his aim is to take care of his children's health and education expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and chemical fertilizers and pay the labourers.

loans.name: Thadeo

texts.en:
Thadeo is a 63-year-old man from the Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  

Thadeo started selling lights in July 2012, and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Nyirantwali Marthe, and their child.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy mulch, pestcides and fuel for running his generator

loans.name: Mamia

texts.en:
Mamia, age 50, would like to start up a small dairy farm business. He lives in Chiatura District with his wife, their three grown sons, and a daughter-in-law. Mamia has requested loans from local financial institutions several times to obtain family business start-up, but without success. His loan request was rejected each time due to low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Currently, the main source of income for the family is the small monthly salaries earned by Mamia’s sons. Two of them are working as bakers and the youngest is in military service. For additional income, Mamia cultivates family-owned agricultural land where he grows different kinds of vegetables. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Mamia has requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business, and his loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Mamia will start up a small dairy farm. He will purchase a milk cow and a piglet with the loan funds. With the milk from the cow, the family will make cheese products and sell these locally at the market. After they raise the piglet, it will be sold at a profitable mark-up. 

This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family income and improve the entire family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and a piglet

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is a 24-year-old married woman with two kids from Maribojoc, Bohol. The oldest child is 4, while the youngest is 2. She is engaged in tuba (coconut wine) vending. She has been in tuba vending for two years. Her husband is a farmer.

She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy tungog (it gives tuba its bitter taste and maroon color) and more containers for wine storage. She works hard in order to meet the family's daily expenses. In the future, Jasmin would like to invest in other ventures to support her growing children as well as be able to send them to school.

loans.use: to buy tungog, which gives tuba (coconut wine) its bitter taste and maroon color, and more containers for storage.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.es:
Benilda, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y al cultivo de maíz, vive con su familia, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 22 y 25 años de edad,  este oficio lo aprendió de su familia y trabaja de 6:00am a 6:00pm, el maíz que cultiva le sirve para la elaboración de la venta de tortillas.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de una cocina de gas, para que le ayude a la venta, esto le dará el beneficio de realizar el proceso más rápido.
Los sueños de Benilda es poder trabajar y realizar mejoras a la vivienda.
texts.en:
Benilda makes a living selling tortillas and growing corn.  She lives with her family and is the single mother of two children, ages 22 and 25.

She learned this work from her family.  She works from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m.  She uses the corn she grows to make tortillas.

She's requesting a loan to buy a gas stove to help her with her sales.  This will help her work faster.

Benilda's dreams are to be able to work and to make improvements on her house.

loans.use: to buy a gas stove

loans.name: Ana Antonia

texts.es:
Ana, está casada, tiene tres hijos de 18, 20, 25, se dedica al destazo y venta de carne, inicio su negocio como una fuente de ingreso para el sustento de su familia, lo aprendió en su familia, lo realiza desde las 5:00am hasta las 11:00am.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de un cerdo y una vaca para poder destazar, este préstamo le dará los recursos para mejorar el negocio, sus ventas y la condición de vida con su familia.
Su objetivo con el préstamo es adquirir materiales para mejorar el negocio, la calidad de vida en su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is married and has three children aged 18, 20, and 25. She earns her living butchering and selling meat, a business she started so she could support her family. Ana learned the work from her parents. She works from 5 am to 11 am. 

Now she is seeking a loan to buy a pig and a cow to slaughter. With this income she will be able to improve her business, increase sales, and improve her family’s standard of living. 

Ana’s goal is to buy materials so she can improve the business and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a pig and a cow

loans.name: Karim

texts.fr:
Monsieur  KARIM  est âgé de 53 ans et vit avec ses sept enfants et son épouse dans une famille nucléaire  dans la sous préfecture  de Ouelessebougou, Région de Koulikoro.
KARIM n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son deuxième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 2 tonnes de maïs  auprès des producteurs qu’il revend en détail à OUELESSEBOUGOU à crédit et au comptant à une clientèle mixte.
KARIM espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en: Mr. KARIM  is 53 years old and lives with his seven children and his wife in a nuclear family in the Ouelessebougou prefecture of the Koulikoro region. KARIM didn’t have the chance to attend school. He became interested early on in making a living, notably in selling grains. He learned about this trade from his maternal uncle, who used to be a big grain seller. With the concern of being able to satisfy his fast-growing clientele, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his second individual loan, which will be used to buy two tons of corn from farmers which he sells at retail in OUELESSEBOUGOU for cash or credit to a mixed clientele. KARIM  hopes to make a monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan and to reinvest into his business.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a 26-year-old farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married and a father of two young children.

Mario is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, he will be able to improve his farm as well as his harvest and yield. 

In the future, Mario dreams of expanding his business and saving money for the future schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 45-year-old married woman and mother of five from San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a rice farming business together with her husband for more than 10 years now.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay school fees for her children. With this loan, she will be able to improve their rice farm and harvest.

In the future, Jocelyn hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Mujeres Unidas está en su ciclo número 1, donde aprenden a trabajar juntas y a hacer actividades que fortalezcan ese compañerismo. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de las integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Sara, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que tiene venta de bebidas y cancha de vóley, también se debe destacar que ella es una persona muy trabajadora y que siempre se ha esforzado por dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en su negocio, y de esa forma tener más bebidas que poder ofrecer a sus clientes y también tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas (United Women) group is in its first cycle.  They are learning to work together and to engage in activities that strengthen their camaraderie. The members took a poverty elimination survey, and the results indicated that two of the members are living below the poverty line.

Sara is one of the members, and she was within level one poverty stage in the last survey.   She says that among the work that she does is selling drinks and a volleyball court.  It also should be noted that she is a very hard-working person.  She has always put forth great effort in order to give her family everything that she was not able to have.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to invest in her business.  This way she will have more drinks to offer her customers, and she will also have better income.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell.

loans.name: Alison

texts.es:
Alison es madre soltera y vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Ella trabaja como auxiliar de aula en una escuela primaria.

Ella solicita el crédito para compra de pintura y estuco para refaccionar un negocio familiar que es una cancha de raqueta que alquilan  para poder tener más ingresos para su familia.

El sueño de Alison es poder independizarse de la casa de sus padres y poder dar una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alison is a single mother and lives with her parents in the neighbourhood of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. She works as a classroom assistant in a primary school.

Alison is seeking a loan to buy paint and plaster to repair a racketball court that her family owns and rents out in order to earn money for the family.

Her dream is to leave the family home and become independent. She wants to be able to provide her children with a better life.

loans.use: buy paint and plaster to repair a racquetball court

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a crushing machine.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, age 45, is a salon proprietor in Shimanzi, Mombasa. She and her husband, who brings in additional income, support three dependents. She has been engaged in her business for the last ten years and she has made the business a success.

This request marks Catherine's second loan from KADET Ltd. She will use her loan funds to purchase beauty creams, shampoo, and a dryer machine for her salon. 

She will use her anticipated profits to expand her business. She hopes to help her family become more financially stable in future.

loans.use: to purchase beauty creams, shampoo, and a dryer machine for her salon

loans.name: Stephen's Group

texts.en:
Stephen is a 65-year-old farmer and father of 19 children. He and his wife keep goats, cows and grow maize to support their family. Four of their children are still in school.

Stephen wants to become a KOMAZA tree farmer to benefit from the skills and training that he will receive from the program. He hopes the income he will receive from the trees at maturity will meet the needs of his family. He would like to use the proceeds from his KOMAZA trees to build a good house and educate his children.

He is excited to join KOMAZA's program because of the benefits to the environment around him from growing trees.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, es casada y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de ocho horas al día vendiendo ropa y accesorios de mujer de forma ambulante, ya que su esposo se fue a trabajar al exterior y no le envía dinero; es por eso que ella es la única que cubre los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para aumentar su mercadería (comprar más ropa y accesorios de mujer) ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has two school-age children.  They live in their own house in three rooms.  The house is located in the Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz.

Currently she works more than eight hours a day as a street vendor selling clothing and women's accessories because her husband went abroad to work and doesn't send her money.  This is why she's the only one who covers her family's expenses for education, food, and basic services.

She needs the loan to increase her merchandise (to buy more clothing and women's accessories) because she wants to improve her income and her family's quality of life.

This is the third time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and the second time from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy clothing and women's accessories

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 44 years old, married and has been blessed with nine children. He owns a brick-making company and has been in business for the past seven years. He also practices farming; he rears livestock and grows horticulture crops. He used to previously grow sugarcane. He is a very hardworking gentleman. 

Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to pay school fees and has also bought a motorbike for transport purposes. He hopes to expand his business and educate his children. He requires a loan of 27,084 KES (Kenyan shillings) to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Charo's Group

texts.en:
Charo, age 55 (shown with his hand raised), is a drylands farmer along with his wife. Their venture is hindered by lack of capital for investment in modern farming tools, good seeds, insecticides, and pesticides. Charo is also a mason. He and his wife have seven children. 

Charo is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program to uplift himself and his family out of poverty. With his loan funds, he will purchase tree farm inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as pay for technical trainings and maintenance support

With the profits from his tree farm, Charo intends to build a house for his family and to ensure that his children get a better education. He tells us that he also wants to "help others join KOMAZA by [setting a] good example from my changes by the KOMAZA project."

loans.use: to purchase tree farm inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical trainings and maintenance support

loans.name: Emilly

texts.en:
Emilly is a 27-year-old tailor. She is a married mother of one. She has been sewing clothes for her customers for the last seven years; she earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings), which she uses to support her family.

Emily is now applying for her first loan from KADET after she was introduced recently by KADET staff. She intends to use the loan to purchase more materials and sewing threads. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child and add more stock.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a well-established business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials and sewing threads.

loans.name: 010314 Bắc Sơn - Hoằng Phụ Group

texts.en:
Dut, age 46, operates a food stall/restaurant business, selling shrimp sauce. She has been engaged in her business for ten years. She is the leader of a seven-member group, the 010314 Bắc sơn - Hoằng Phụ solidarity group. She and her husband have raised two children who are now grown, so Duy supports no dependents. Her business is located in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

The main hardship that Duy faces in her business is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish for making fish sauce.

In the future, Duy hopes to maintain a successful enterprise and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business. Her goal is for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fish for making fish sauce.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Esperanza nace gracias a que una de las miembros invito a sus amigas y vecinas para formar un grupo, el cual les ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y también seguir ayudando a sus familias.
La sra. Felipa es Comerciante, se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos, como ser  Cosméticos, Ropa, Zapatos, etc . Ella esta casada con el señor  Oscar y tienen 4 hijo. Felipa cuenta que tiene muy buenas ventas, ya que siempre da de forma accesible a sus clientes,y con ello esta creciendo. Cuenta que tiene ya una buena clientela, pero que quiere seguir creciendo, es por eso que solicita de este crédito, para poder invertirlo en la compra de Cosméticos, Ropa, Zapatos, y demás, para poder tener mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda, no solo a ella, sino tambien a sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The group “La Esperanza” (Hope) was born thanks to one of its members, who invited her friends and neighbors to form this group. It helps them to increase their income and also to continue helping their families.

Ms. Felipa is a businesswoman who sells all kinds of products, for example, cosmetics, clothing, shoes, etc. She is married to Mr. Oscar and they have four children. Felipa states that she has good sales and, since she always has good customers, her business is growing.

She states that she has a good customer base, but that she would like her business to continue to grow. She is applying for a loan in order to buy more cosmetics, clothing, shoes, etc. in order to have a greater variety of products to offer her customers. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving, as it would be of great help, not only for her but also for the other members of the group.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothing, and shoes, among other things to sell.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Esperanza está en su  primer ciclo, y tienen muchas ganas de salir adelante y por medio de las capacitaciones llegar al máximo nivel del programa. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 de ellas  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cornelia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno cuenta cuenta que hace empanadas y milanesas para la venta, y que con este trabajo tiene los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia. Es una persona que quiere dar a sus familiares todo lo que ella no pudo tener, es por eso que se esfuerza tanto.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de carne, harina, huevos, discos de empanadas, verduras y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo las empanadas y milanesas que hace, ya que esto le ayudará a tener mejores ingresos y mejorar su plan de negocios.
texts.en:
The Hope group is in its first loan cycle. The members are very keen to  get ahead and reach the highest level of the training program. Four of the women were found to be living below the poverty line after they completed the poverty elimination survey. 

One of the group members is Sra. Cornelia whose last survey results showed level 1 poverty. She makes and sells empanadas and milanesas (fried foods in breadcrumbs). With the money she earns she is able to help her family. Cornelia is the type of person who wants to give to her family all the things that she wasn’t able to have--that’s why she works so hard.

Cornelia is seeking a loan to buy meat, flour, eggs, empanada rounds, vegetables and other ingredients so she can continue making empanadas and milanesas. This will help her earn more money and improve the business.

loans.use: buy meat, flour, eggs, empanada rounds, vegetables and other ingredients

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 55 years old. He is from Olkalau and is married to Rhoda with whom he has four children who are in school.

Joseph is a farmer and has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying his previous loan well. He hopes to use the loan amount to buy a cow.

He hopes to buy a firm in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for his sibling.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 58-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has two grown children. She engages in selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for 23 years now. This is the source of her income.

Gloria is requesting for a loan to buy many kinds of fruits and vegetables. Through this loan, she will be able to buy fruits and vegetables like mangos, squash, bitter gourds, and avocados to sell in her place.

In the future, Gloria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: 010501 Xuân Phụ  - Hoằng Phụ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thăng works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise. Thăng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Thăng is 41 years old and married with two children. One of her children is grown up, so Thăng supports one dependent with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

The main hardship that Thăng faces in her business is the lack of capital. In 2011, Thăng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thăng has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 010501 Xuân Phụ - Hoằng Phụ solidarity group. 

In the future, Thăng hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah used her previous loan amount to buy more stock of chicken feed for her chickens. It was profitable, since the chickens laid more eggs for sale, and she also sold some of the chickens to her customers.

This being Monicah’s third loan, she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of chicken feed for her new stock of chickens. This includes both growers’ mash and layers’ mash. She anticipates generating more profits from the sale of the chickens.

Monicah hopes to expand her chicken business by supplying the chickens and eggs to other markets in the region, and thereby make more income.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed for her chicken-rearing business.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She lives with her family in San Miguel, Bohol. 

Lucila earns a living through her sari-sari or retail business, selling various goods and commodities to the people in her place. Lucila is also in the dressmaking and tailoring business. 

Lucila is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, soap, soda and beverages, rice, chips and snack foods. Also, she plans to buy materials for her tailoring business like cloth, thread and other items. Lucila believes that this loan can help her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, soap, soda and beverages, rice, chips and snack foods.

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah benefited from the previous loan by increasing her farm output, and she was able to meet her family’s needs.

She has applied for her fourth loan from KADET LTD after paying her previous loan well. She hopes to use the loan amount to rent a shamba (field), cultivate, and buy farm inputs.

Priscillah hopes to educate her children and be well established in the near future.

loans.use: to rent a shamba (field), cultivate, and buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es:
Cinthia es soltera y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en una casa en anticrético y ocupan dos habitaciones pequeñas, la casa se encuentra en la zona Ernesto torrez de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente Cinthia trabaja por más de ocho horas al día como secretaria en una entidad privada, ya que con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar mercadería (ropa y accesorios para mujer) ya que desea tener otros ingresos vendiendo ropa y accesorios de forma ambulante.
El sueño de Cinthia, es tener su propia tienda de ropa para estar más tiempo con sus hijos.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Cinthia is a single mother of two children who go to school. They all live in a house with two small rooms under an “anticrético” mode [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you]. The house is located in the Ernesto Torrez area, in La Paz.

Cinthia currently works for more than 8 hours a day as a secretary for a private company. With the income she receives, she must pay for her family’s food and education and for the utilities.

Cinthia is requesting a loan to buy merchandise (clothes and accessories for women). She is planning to sell these items working as a street vendor.

Cinthia dreams of having her own clothes store so that she can spend more time with her children. This is the first time she requests a loan to IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories for women, sell them, and have an additional income source to support her family.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru:
Зафар,ответственный   молодой мужчина. Он    женат имеет четверых детей на воспитании.  Зафар  занимается купля продажей  скота.  Этим видом деятельности занимается несколько лет.  Жена домохозяйка но она помогает мужу по откорму скота.  Кроме животноводства Зафар подрабатывает  перевозкой  овощей и фруктов на грузовой машине.  
Зафар кредитуется в Арванде с 2006 года и некогда не имел просрочки, он очень пунктуальный и добросовестный человек.  В очередной раз он обратился в Арванд за кредитом.  Планирует купить скотов и увеличить свое стадо.  
  Зафар очень надеется на поддержку от Арванд и заранее благодарит за поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Zafar is a responsible young man.  He's married and is raising four children.  Zafar earns his living buying and selling cattle and has done so for several years.  His wife is a homemaker, but helps him feed their herd.  Additionally, Zafar earns money transporting fruits and vegetables by truck.  He has been a client at Arvand since 2006 and has never been late with repayment.  He's a very punctual and conscientious person.  Once again, he has come to Arvand for a loan.  He plans to increase the number of cattle in his herd.  Zafar has high hopes for Arvand's support and is grateful for the support and understanding.

loans.use: to buy a cattle

loans.name: 010318 Bắc Sơn - Hoằng Phụ Group

texts.en:
Ca, age 52, operates a food stall/restaurant business, where she sells shrimp sauce. She has been engaged in her business for 10 years. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 010318 Bắc Sơn - Hoằng Phụ solidarity group. She and her husband have two children, one of whom is now grown. The younger child is still a dependent. Ca's business is located in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her primary business challenge is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish for making fish sauce. Ca joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2012 to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
 
In the future, Ca hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business and to make enough money to provide for her family. Her goal is for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fish for making fish sauce

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 58 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for more than 6 years and earns 18,000 PHP every month. She been with GDMPC since 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like sugar, coffee, shampoo, soap and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like sugar, coffee, shampoo, soap and canned goods

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Emprendedoras está en su ciclo número once, donde, según la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, 2 de las integrantes estan por debajo de la linea de ingresos.
Una de las miembros, la Sra. Viviana, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. Comenta que se esta esforzando y esta poniendo todo de ella para poder mejorar sus ingresos y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia. Quiere poder seguir trabajando ya que sabe que esta es la única forma de poder salir adelante. Ella se dedica a la Venta de Frutas y solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas de estación, como ser Manzanas, naranjas, peras, ciruelas, etc., lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named Las Emprendedoras is in its eleventh cycle where, according to the survey for the elimination of poverty, two of the members are below the poverty line.

One of the members, Viviana, in her last survey showed a poverty level within the first level. She comments that she is struggling and putting all of herself into being able to improve her income and therefore continue helping her family. She wants to continue working since she knows that this is the only way to be able to come out ahead. She sells fruit and is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of fruits of the season, like apples, oranges, pears, plums, etc., which will help her to fix her business plan and to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fruit, such as apples, oranges, pears, plums, etc.

loans.name: Atipay Group

texts.es:
(La señora Carmen está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La socia Carmen nació en la ciudad de Puno pero actualmente vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 35 años de edad pero es soltera. Su actividad económica principal de la Carmen es la venta de zapatos para niños, caballeros y damas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Carmen requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo zapatos para niños porque se está acercando la campaña escolar. Su sueño de la socia Carmen es abrir otras tiendas en las ciudades de Puerto Maldonado, Sicuani y Quillabamba. 

Este grupo está conformado por vecinos y amigos que formaron el banco comunal “Atipay” en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; preparación de refrigerios, movilidad escolar, docente, apoyo de encuestas, venta de calzados, venta de cosméticos, alquiler de disfraces típicos y otros son restauradores de obras de arte, empleados públicos y otros docentes de música.  
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (Los socios que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía llegaron tarde a la reunión del banco comunal).
texts.en:
(Carmen is raising her hand in the photo)  Carmen was born in the city of Puno, but right now she lives in the beautiful city of Cuzco. She is 35 years old and single. Carmen's main economic activity is selling children's, men's and women's shoes. She has been doing this job for several years now and it is going very well for her. At this time, Carmen needs a loan to buy merchandise, such as, for example, children's shoes, because the school year is starting soon. Carmen's dream is to open other stores in the cities of Puerto Maldonado, Sicuani and Quillabamba. 

This group is made up of neighbors and friends who make up the “Atipay” communal bank in the province and department of Cuzco. This communal bank is made up of people who are always seeking opportunities to get ahead and with their daily work give their children a better future. The economic activities of the members are, for example, making snacks, school transportation, teaching, surveying assistant, selling shoes, selling cosmetics, renting out traditional costumes, restoring art, working as public employees, and teaching music.
  
The members in general are grateful for the opportunity that has been given and they are committed to making their different payments on time. The members that appear in the bottom part of the photo came late to the communal bank meeting.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, for example, children's shoes.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
This is Luzviminda, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Marion and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Luzviminda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Luzviminda is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Luzviminda hopes that her business will grow and dreams of having her own lot with a title. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: tp pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en: Adelina is 53 years old, married and lives in the Philippines with her husband and one child. For the last five years, she has earned a living by providing transportation services to people who live in her community. She earns about 35,000 PHP a month and is applying for a loan for 45,000 PHP to repair the vehicle that she uses to transport her passengers. Last year, Adelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and life. In the future, she hopes to provide a better standard of living to her family.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle used in her transportation business.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора умелая швея. Она шьёт прекрасные национальные платья для женщин.   Также Гулнора умело вышивает на платье бисера, бусы, создаёт декоративные цветы из них и украшает ими платье.  Гулнора швея с детство.   У неё талант к этому мастерству. В юношеском возрасте ходила на ученики к швейному мастеру. Там же она научилась всем тонкостям своего дела.    Как подчеркнула сама Гулнора, её наставница была очень требовательной и сумела передать своё мастерство и воспитать в Гулноре хорошую швею. Когда Гулнора создала семью и родила троих детей нужда в больших средствах увеличилось и она решила самостоятельно открыть цех.     Шесть  лет назад привлекла нескольких подруг- швеи, арендовала помещение рядом с рынком.  Поначалу Гулнора пользовалась швейной машинкой, которая арендовала вместе с цехом.   Но потом решила приобрести  новую собственную швейную машинку. Для этого обратилась в МДО «Арванд» и получив поддержку со стороны организации она приобрела швейную машинку. Теперь же  в связи  увеличением  потребности семьи в дополнительных средствах Гулнора хочет купить собственную  вышивальную  машинку.   Этим она и её «маленький бизнес» смогут «выжить» и она продолжит обслуживать  большее количество клиентов зарабатывая нужную сумму на образование детей и благополучие своей семьи.   Она очень надеется, что приобретённый кредит от Арванд поможет ей не остаться на половине пути и перешагнуть этот трудный момент.
texts.en: Gulnora is a skilled seamstress, having begun sewing in her childhood.  She sews beautiful national dresses for women.  She also skillfully embroiders beads and decorative flowers that she uses to adorn her dresses.  Her talent is masterful.  As a youth, she took lessons from a skilled artisan.  There, she learned all the details of her craft.  As Gulnora herself has said, her teacher was very demanding but managed to pass along her skills and mold her into the talent she is today.  When Gulnora started her family and had three children, the need for income increased and she decided to open her own shop.  Six years ago, she and a few of her seamstress friends rented a space near a market.  initially, Gulnora used a sewing machine that she rented with the space.  But she later decided she wanted to buy a new sewing machine for herself.  For the means to do so, she turned to Arvand.  With their support, she did just that.  Now, with the increasing needs of her family, she wants to buy her own embroidery machine.  With this machine, her small business will be able to survive and she will be able to continue to offer her services to a larger number of clients.  This will allow her to earn enough money for her family and her children's education.  She hopes that this loan from Arvand will help her advance closer to her goals and to move past this difficult time.

loans.use: to buy embroidery machines

loans.name: Jose Vidal

texts.es:
José, está nuevamente interesado en solicitar un préstamo para trabajar, ya que iniciara la siembra de cultivo agrícola, para esto necesita el aporte financiero y comprar fertilizantes y semilla de maíz, con estos materiales podrá dar inicio a la nueva jornada agrícola.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, mejoro la productividad de la tierra, le dio mejores beneficios, sus ingresos por la venta de la cosecha y las condiciones en su familia.
texts.en: José is once again interested in applying for a loan to work, since the planting has started. For this, he needs financial support and to buy fertilizer and corn seeds. With these supplies, he will be able to start a new farming season. The effect of the previous loan was positive. It improved the productivity of the land. It gave him better profits and income from the sale of the harvest, and improved conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and corn seeds.

loans.name: Las Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Luchadoras está en su ciclo número cuatro, el grupo lleva ese nombre ya que todas las integrantes son mujeres muy luchadoras que se esfuerzan por ir creciendo y ayudando a sus familias. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde tres integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Emilia, quien esta trabajando muy duro para mejorar sus ingresos, ya que esta en el nivel uno, es consciente,que solo esforzándose podrá ir creciendo. Ella cuenta que se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo, y que así esta tratando de mejorar. Esta poniendo todo de ella y eso es muy loable.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de panificados, carne, lechuga, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos, cumpliendo así con sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is called ”Las Luchadoras” [Tenacious Women] and is in its fourth cycle. They chose this name because all members are hardworking women who struggle to grow and help their families. They have taken part in a poverty reduction survey and three of them were found to be living below the poverty line.

One of the group’s members is Mrs. Emilia, who works hard to increase her income. She is in level one, and she is conscious that in order to grow, she will have to work hard. She says that she sells all types of foods and that this is her way of improving. She is trying as hard as she can, which is something laudable.

Mrs. Emilia is requesting a loan to buy bakery products, meat and lettuce, which will help her to realize her business plan, improve her income and serve her customers better.

loans.use: to buy bakery products, meat and lettuce, among other things.

loans.name: Umatoy

texts.ru:
Уматой  женщина в возрасте 48 лет.   Она  замужем и  имеет троих детей.  Дети у нее уже взрослые.  Ее вид деятельности заключается в том,что она занимается куплей продажей сухофруктов.  Уматой привозит сухофруктов с соседнего города и продает в своем селе.  У нее очень много клиентов.  
Уматой обратилась в организацию Арванд за кредитом.  У нее проблемы с зубами.  С самого детства она страдала, ходила по стоматологам, теперь к 48 годам у нее почти не осталась зубов.  Уматой берет кредит для лечение зубов и  хочет вставить металлокерамические коронки. Они очень дорогие но она вынуждена вставить их так как уже не может нормально употреблять пищу. Ей приходится очень тяжело. Уматой накопила денежные средства но  на коронки немного не  хватает, поэтому  она запросила кредит.   Надеется,что в Арванде ее поддержат и она сможет вылечить  свои зубы.
texts.en: Umatoy is 48 years old, she's married and has three children who are already grown.  To earn an income, she buys and sells dried fruit.  Umatoy brings in her products from a neighboring city and sells them in her village.  She has many clients.  Umatoy has turned to Arvand for a loan.  She has problems with her teeth and has since her childhood when she constantly visited dentists.  Now that she's 48, she has almost no teeth remaining.  Umatoy is taking out a loan to receive dental treatment and would like to have metal-ceramic crowns put in.  They are very expensive but she needs them as she is unable to eat food normally which is very difficult for her.  Umatoy has been saving up for this, but she's just short of the total amount.  She hopes that Arvand will support her and that she will be able to heal her teeth.

loans.use: for dental treatment

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, age 43, runs a general store business to earn an income. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns PhP 8,000 every month. She and her husband have two children and live in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. 

Arlene joined GDMPC in 2010 and has been a member in good standing ever since. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000, which she will use to purchase products like sugar, coffee, soap, shampoo, and canned goods to sell in her store. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this investment to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase products like sugar, coffee, soap, shampoo, and canned goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a 54-year-old farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She works with her husband tilling and cultivating their farm. Luz is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

Luz dreams of making her farming business successful and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for reinvestment in the same venture and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Germocila

texts.en:
Germocila is a 45-year-old married woman from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She has seven children. The youngest child is nine months old while the oldest is 24. She is involved in a hog-fattening business. She raises pigs.

Aside from the hog-raising business, Germocila runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items such as sugar, coffee, condiments, noodles, toiletries and canned goods. Her husband is a carpenter. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy additional piglets, feed and groceries to sell in her store. In the future, Germocila would like to expand her business to support her family, and to save so she is able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen de Guadalupe es de la ciudad de Villa Ygatimi, esta en su tercer ciclo del programa, y con mucho esfuerzo y lucha lo están haciendo. Según la encuesta hecha a las integrantes del grupo, 3 de las integrantes están por debajo de la línea de la pobreza, siendo una de ellas, la Sra. Matilde, quien está trabajando duro por salir adelante, pero muchas veces sus ingresos no les son suficientes.
Ella se dedica a lavar ropas de sus vecinos, es un trabajo muy sacrificado según cuenta, pero lo hace, ya que de esa forma está ayudando a su familia. Su sueño es poder tener algún día un negocio propio y así seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de jabones para lavar, suavizante y demás, que son los insumos que utiliza para seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group called Virgen de Guadalupe is from the city of Villa Ygatimi, it is in its third loan cycle of the program and with a lot of effort and fight the members are making it. According to the survey carried out among the members of the group, three of them live below the poverty line. One of these women is Matilde who is working hard to get ahead in life, but on many occasions, this simply isn't enough.

Mathilde makes her living washing her neighbors' clothes, she tells of how it is a very tiring form of work, but she does it as it is in this manner that she is helping her family. Her dream is to one day own her own business and therein continue helping her family. Mathilde is seeking this loan to buy soap to wash, softener and more, which are the basic items she uses to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy soap, softener and more.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Oñondivepa  está en su 3° ciclo, donde 12 de las integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, pero por medio de su trabajo quieren ir creciendo para poder ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Estela, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, y está ganando terreno, ya que hace poco empezó con este negocio, ella tiene muchas ganas de crecer y de ir mejorando en su negocio y es por eso que día a día lucha.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de shorts, remeras, vestidos, camisillas, ropa interiores etc, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Agradece por la gran ayuda que están recibiendo, ya que es una excelente oportunidad para ellas.
texts.en: Oñondivepa is on its third loan cycle. Twelve of the members live below the poverty line, but through their work, they want to grow to be able to help their families. One of the members is Estela. She works selling clothing, and she is making progress, since she only started this business a little while ago. She has a lot of desire to grow and improving in her business, and this is why she fights every day. She is applying for this loan to buy shorts, T-shirts, dresses, shirts, underwear, etcetera, which will help her to shore up her business plan, which will help her to increase her income. She is grateful for all the help that they are receiving, since it is a excellent opportunity for them.

loans.use: to buy shorts, T-shirts, dresses, shirts, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Makongo Kk Group

texts.en:
Justina - who is in her early 30s - is married with three children, one son and two daughters, all of whom go to school. She has been running two businesses, selling charcoal and sells vitumbua. She has been in business for six years now.  

This will be Justina's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more sacks of charcoal, some kilos of rice, a bucket of cooking oil and a few kilos of sugar (all these items used for making vitumbua) as well as paid school fees and covered household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She will use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal, some kilos of rice and to pay school fees. Her dream is to one day be able to finish building her house.

Justina will share this loan with her loan group, "Makongo Kk”, which has 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal, some kilos of rice and to pay school fees.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 39 years old and single. She lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been in this business for over nine years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase piglets to raise and sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Zaum

texts.en:
Zaum is 44 years old, married, and has four children. To earn a living, she runs a salon; she has been in this business for the past 13 years. She also earns extra income by conducting hairdressing training in her salon for a small fee. With the income from her business, she is able to pay school fees for her four children and cater to their basic needs. One of them is already self-reliant.

Zaum wishes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She needs a loan of 53,156 KES to buy cosmetics and hair braids.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair braids.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice, age 37, runs a small-scale horticulture business in Elgeiyo Marakwet County. His wife supports him in running the business and producing additional income. He has been in this business for the last three years and earns a monthly profit of Kshs 10,000. 

Maurice and his wife are blessed with three children.

He has requested a loan in the amount of Kshs 91,000 from KADET Ltd, which he intends to use to start a new barber shop business. He will purchase a pool table and equipment for the new shop with his loan funds. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business as well as diversify his ventures to increase his income.

His hopes are to improve his family's living standards, to be financially stable, and to save money to enable him to pay school fees for his children. His aspiration is eventually to expand his new barber shop business to other towns.

loans.use: to purchase necessary equipment and a pool table for his new barber shop business

loans.name: Juntas Y Unidas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Marilu ella es casada y tiene 41 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de materiales de construcción como pinturas,yeso,cementos y ladrillos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, por medio de este negocio a la socia le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales de construcción. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pinturas, ladrillos, pinturas y cementos.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de libros, negocio de venta de tortas, negocio de venta de tejidos y negocio de venta de materiales de construcción.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Juntas y Unidas” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, part of the Cusco province and department. The member in question is Marilu, she is married, 41 years old and has one child. Marilu works in her business selling construction materials such as paint, plaster, cement and bricks, working from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. Marilu has been working in this business for 5 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand the construction material business. She is seeking this loan to buy paint, bricks and cement.

The other members make their living selling books, selling cakes, selling fabrics and construction materials. 

Marilu is grateful to those people who form part of this dream through this method, and she pledges to meet the repayments in the fixed time frame.

loans.use: to buy paint, bricks and cement.

loans.name: Davlat

texts.ru:
Давлат житель города Истаравшан.  Он  трудолюбивый  и честный мужчина. Женат и имеет на воспитании  двоих детей . Жена не работает, занимается воспитанием детей.  Сам Давлат    занимается купля продажей автомобильных запчастей.  Этим  делом он занимается уже 4 года.   Этот  вид деятельности является  единственным доходом в семье.   Давлат приобретает запчасти в другом городе и продает  на рынке своего города.   Для расширения своего бизнеса Давлат обратился в организацию Арванд за кредитом.  
Он запрашивает кредит для за купа авто запчастей.    Очень надеется,что в Арванде  ему не откажут в финансовом вопросе.
texts.en: Davlat is married and lives in Istaravshan, Tajikistan with his wife and two children.  He's a hardworking and honest man. His wife raises their children and does not work outside of the home.  Davlat has worked the last four years buying and selling auto parts; this is the family's sole source of income.  Davlat purchases parts in another city and sells them at a market in his own.  To expand his business, he has turned to Arvand for a loan so he can buy more inventory.  He hopes that Arvand will not turn him away.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en: Wilfredo, a 35-year-old married entrepreneur with 3 children in Poblacion, Bonifacio, earns money from his private transport service business. It was started almost three years ago and he earns about 10,000 PHP a month. To improve business, he is borrowing the amount of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit to buy accessories and tires. He just joined GDMPC in 2011. He’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business before long.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa, a 44-year-old married mother of two, lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur where she owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. In operation for over six years, she earns 2,000PHP every month.

Marissa has requested a loan of 3,000PHP to purchase more products to sell such as sugar, coffee and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like sugar, coffee and canned goods.

loans.name: Marta Gloria

texts.es:
Marta, para comprar más semilla de marañón, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque considera que es necesaria la inversión para aumentar la disponibilidad para vender, con esta compra ampliara sus ventas a los clientes. 
Con el préstamo anterior ella obtuvo un efecto positivo, ya que surtió el negocio de más semillas, con el objetivo de permanecer en las ventas para generar más ingresos, en su familia se han mantenido bien, en este periodo cambio de Dirección, viviendo en un nuevo lugar.
texts.en:
To buy more cashew nut seeds, Marta is seeking a new loan because she feels an investment is necessary to increase the availability to sell, and with this purchase, she will increase her sales to her customers.

The previous loan had a positive effect on Marta as she stocked the business with more seeds, with the aim to continuing sales to generate more income. In this period of change in management, her family has carried on steadily with life in a new area.

loans.use: to buy cashew nut seeds.

loans.name: Melvin Vladimir

texts.es:
Melvin, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, porque ha tenido buenos resultados, solicita en esta ocasión para la compra de inventarios, pollo, salsas, pollo, empanizado, aceite, entre otras variedad de productos que le sirvan para atender la demanda.
Con el préstamo anterior, tuvo un efecto positivo, el objetivo era tener un inventario fuerte para aumentar las ventas, en su familia considera que las ganancias le han servido, ahora tienen una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en: Melvin decided to take a new loan, since the previous one was such a success. He asks for funds to buy the supplies he needs to meet demand: chicken, sauces, grated bread, cooking oil, and others. The previous loan aimed at having more products in stock in order to increase his sales. It was a success in that it helped him and his family have a better quality of life thanks to the extra income.

loans.use: to buy the supplies he needs to make breaded chicken.

loans.name: Mahmudjon

texts.ru:
Махмудчон занимается откормом скота в течении 5 лет. У него большая семья, жена и пятеро  детей, четыре девочек и единственный сын. Самому младшему 7 лет. Так как у них пятеро детей его жена вынуждена сидеть дома и заниматься их воспитанием, ведь это большая ответственность. 
Сам   Махмудчон  с ранних лет занимается выращиванием скота.  Он живет в кишлаке и этот вид деятельности является в его местности очень актуальным.  Махмудчон перепродает скот и имеет очень хороший доход от этого. У него большие планы на будущее, он   мечтает чтобы его дети получили высшее  образование  и в будущем устроились на хорошую работу.  Также Махмудчон  хочет  построить дом  своему единственному сыну.   Он   уже сейчас  думает о будущем своего сына, и надеется,что в старости его сын будет ему опорой.  
Для того,чтобы начать строительство дома  Махмудчон планирует увеличить поголовье скота и расширить свой бизнес по животноводству.  Затем на накопившие деньги он начнет строить дом.  
На запрашиваемый кредит Махмудчон купит скот и откормив,через некоторое время надеется продать  за выгодную цену.
texts.en: Mahmudjon has earned a living fattening cattle for five years.  He has a large family which includes his wife and five children--four girls and one son.  His youngest is seven years old.  Because he has five children, his wife is needed in the home and she spends her time raising them.  This is a big responsibility.  Mahmudjon has raised cattle since he was young.  He lives in a village where this sort of work is very important.  He receives a good income from reselling his cattle.  He has big plans for the future and dreams that his children will be able to receive a higher education and that they will find good jobs.  Mahmudjon also wants to build a home for his only son.  He is already thinking of his son's future and hopes that in his old age, his son will be a mainstay.  In order to start building a home, Mahmudjon plans to increase the number of cattle among his herd and therefore expand his business.  Then, with the money he's saved, he will begin construction.  He asks for a loan to buy cattle and feed, he hopes to sell these cattle at a good price.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр женат, у него двое детей. Александр торгует фруктами и овощами на рынке. Он покупает их оптом у фермеров и продает в розницу. Работает уже 8 лет. Торговое место арендует. Александр трудолюбивый и настойчивый. Он планирует открыть свой небольшой магазин с той же группой товара.

Александр просит предоставить ему кредит для закупки большой партии яблок. Он планирует поехать в другую область Украины, закупить много яблок и продавать в розницу.
texts.en: Alexander is married and has two children.  He sells fruit and vegetables.  He buys them in bulk from farmers and sells them at a market where he rents space to sell from.  This has been his work for 8 years.  Alexander is hardworking and persistent.  He plans to open a small store selling the same fruits and vegetables.  He is asking for a loan so that he can travel to another region of Ukraine and buy apples that he will sell at the market.

loans.use: To buy apples to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is still doing her business as a fruits seller, and the business is doing well. Her farming business is also doing well, and she was able to repay the previous loan well. 

Jane is requesting a third loan from KADET to buy stock of avocados, apples, kale, cabbages and mangoes to realize more profits. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business. 

Her dreams are to have a well-established business as a fruits supplier.

loans.use: to buy stock of avocados, apples, kale, cabbages and mangoes.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is a married woman with four children. Fe is 43 years old, residing in Tabuan, Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Fe owns and operates a retail store where she sells soft drinks and many items to earn a living, and she's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP. Recently, Fe joined GDMPC. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. In the future, Fe wants to build a house and for her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Besik

texts.en:
Besik is 41 years old. He lives in Sachkhere District with his wife, retired mother and two children who are going to school. Besik requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for his family business start-up but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Besik is working as a builder on private orders. His family has one milk cow, and Besik’s wife is milking it everyday to make cheese. They sell it locally at the market and get a very small monthly income. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs within the subsistence poor category. 

Besik requested a loan from Credo to start-up his family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor which do not have access to credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Besik will purchase a mini-bus to transport building materials. He will work on transportation and earn additional monthly income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will help him to develop his business which will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus to transport building materials.

loans.name: Nseese  Kakwekulakulanya Group

texts.en:
Patrick is a 41-year-old man with seven children who all go to school. He lives in Lyantonde, a trading center that is near Mbarara town. He has a retail shop that helps him take care of his family. His customers are people within his village. He also does some subsistence farming.

He has asked for a loan for buying corn flour, rice, cooking oil, soap and other items for the shop.

Patrick's dream is to see all seven of his children obtain a university education. He also wishes that the lending rates would come down.

In the photograph, Patrick is in front, squatting.

loans.use: to buy corn flour, cooking oil, rice and soap for his retail shop.

loans.name: Neil

texts.en:
Neil is 34 years old and married with one child. He lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, he cultivates farmland, planting and harvesting corn for sale in the local community. He has been with his business for over five years and earns 9,000 PHP every month.

Neil joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities, and now he has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 53-year-old, married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has four grown children. She has been engaged in a farming business for 33 years. She grows rice in this area. She earns 6,000 PHP in a month. This is the source of her income.

Lucia is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, medicine, and seedlings. These will be used in her farming business. Through this loan, she will be able to buy what she needs for her business. Lucia hopes to expand her business, in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, medicine, and seedlings to use in cultivating rice

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 44-year-old gentleman, who is married to Franciscah and has children aged between 12 and 16 years old. 

He was a member who joined KADET a while back, but the group dissolved after some internal wrangles. He instead decided to rejoin afresh with another group, and now he has applied for his first loan of KES 40,000, which he will use to restock his hardware business with glass products. He plans to use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business, and to pay school fees for his children.

His future dreams are to enlarge his venture, and to own his own residential plot.

loans.use: To pay for glass products, for inventory for his hardware business

loans.name: Marvin Yovani

texts.es: Marvin es una persona muy responsable y de excelente referencias de pago, por lo que es alguien confiable en muchos sentidos. Él vive junto a su esposa y una hija quienes son el mayor motivo para ser mejor. Marvin posee una tapicería en la que se dedica a la reparación de muebles como: juegos de sala, comedores, roperos, sillas y otros más, cuenta con varios años de experiencia lo que le ayuda a realizar un trabajo de mucha calidad, razón por la que cuenta con muchos clientes que se sienten satisfechos con su trabajo. Marvin solicita un préstamo para comprar: tela, pegamento, madera, forros, hilos y todo lo necesario para poder aceptar mayor cantidad de trabajo, lo cual para él es una bendición debido a que más trabajo es más ganancia para él y su familia.
texts.en: Marvin is a very responsable person who has excellent payment references and because of this he is a trustworthy individual in many senses. He lives together with his wife and daughter who are his primary motivation for self improvement. Marvin possess an upholstery business where he works repairing furniture, such as: game room furniture, canteens, dressers, chairs and other items. He has many years of experience that allow him to complete his very high quality work which is the reason why he has many clients who are satisfied with his work. Marvin seeks a loan to buy: fabrics, wood, linings, threads and all of the items necessary for him to be be able to accept the majority of his work which, for him, is a blessing because more work equals more earnings for him and his family

loans.use: to buy wood, fabric and threads for upholstery.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 60 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Jemeniz, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail general store in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over 10 years, and she earns 9,000 PHP every month.

She joined GDMPC in the year 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, like coffee, sugar, shampoo, soap and canned goods. She plans to use the additional profit generated, to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, like coffee, sugar, shampoo, soap and canned goods

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger, age 42, operates a motorcycle transport business. He has been engaged in this venture for more than four years now and it is the source of his income. He and his wife have an eight-year-old daughter and live in Trinidad, Bohol. 

Roger is requesting a loan in order to buy spare parts for the motorcycle, such as tires, nuts, and bolts, as well as fuel. With this investment, he will be able to maintain his vehicle in good working condition.
 
Roger aspires toward making his business a success. He intends to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle, such as tires, nuts, and bolts, as well as fuel

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is still practicing mixed farming. He now earns a monthly income of KES 6,000 after getting financial support from KADET LTD. Peter is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. He will use the loan to buy piglets to rear and sell; this is to expand his pig-keeping project. With the expected profits, he will venture into poultry farming. His hopes and dreams are to have an established business as a mixed farmer.

loans.use: buy  piglets to rear and sell.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a 36-year-old,  married woman from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She has two children, ages 11 and 12 years. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells shampoo, chips, chocolates, sugar, beverages and canned goods. In addition to the sari-sari, she also engages in selling RTW (ready-to-wear clothing), like pants, shorts, blouses, skirts and t-shirts, for both genders.

Beatriz requested a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy more inventory for the sari-sari, like rice and soft drinks, and to buy additional clothing inventory for her RTW business. Beatriz would like to expand her business to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for the sari-sari, like rice and soft drinks, and to buy additional clothing inventory for her RTW business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old and married with one child. He has been running his business for about six years with an income of about 12,000 KES.

He is taking out a second loan after successfully repaying the previous one. He wants to use the loan to buy furniture for the food stall. He hopes to have a chain of hotels in the future.

loans.use: to buy furniture for the food stall.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa, age 46, operates a grocery store business in her village. For additional income, she raises hogs. She and her husband Antonio have four children and she works hard to support her family.

With the goal of continuing to earn a good income for her children, she is asking for a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000. She will use her loan funds to buy feed and vaccines for the sustainabilty of her hogs. This will help ensure her ability to provide her hogs with good nutrition.

In the future, Teresa hopes to keep growing healthy hogs so she can offer them at higher cost, earning profits for the purposes of educating her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for the sustainabilty of her hogs

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 53 years old, married and has children to sustain. To earn income, she accepts orders for sewing services for school uniforms, curtains, and tablecloths. She usually earns PHP 3,000 each month, which she uses for school fees and other education-related expenses.

She hopes to continue producing a high output, and that is why she asks for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fabrics, thread, and needles to use in sewing. Additional profit generated from the business will be kept for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads and needles to use in sewing

loans.name: 27 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “27 DE MAYO  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Susana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: compra y venta de ganado, costura de ropa de bebe, venta de api, venta de comida, venta de carne de cordero.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Susana es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta api; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su familia, ya que la misma realizan esta actividad desde hace treinta años, posteriormente decide abrir su propio espacio de comercialización.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de aceite y api) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
