loans.use: to buy more sheep to produce more diary products to sell to the local village people.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq runs a clothing store in the city of Qalqilia. He is single and helps his family pay part of their monthly expenses. His store is a profitable project and is located in a good place in the city. Tareq wants to improve his store by buying more clothes to sell.

He requested a loan from FATEN to purchase clothes to sell and to increase his store's sales.

Tareq is photographed above in his store.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de los Ángeles vive junto a su madre en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, granos básicos, leche, pan, jabones, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas lo que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, la tienda esta ubicada en su vivienda en una comunidad muy transitada de personas , ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque es la tienda mas surtida con productos de calidad, a muy buenos precios y además con un servicio excelente; María es una mujer emprendedora, activa, dedicada a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le abran camino al éxito, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio pero necesita realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, producto instantáneo, bebidas, jabones, etc. María de los Ángeles  tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable se siente muy agradecida con la ayuda, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: María lives with her mother in a home she owns. She has a store where she sells primary-need items, such as basic grains, milk, bread, soaps and other items. She has had the business for a number of years and has a lot of experience in sales, allowing her to make good profits. The store is located in her home in a highly frequented area of her community. Many of her customers prefer her store because it is better stocked with quality products, has very good prices and has excellent service. María is an active, enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and has a strong desire to make headway, so she is always looking for new opportunities to open paths to success. Like all good merchants, she wants to increase her business, but she needs to make a new investment, which is why she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Apoyo Integral that will allow her to purchase basic grains, snacks, instant meals, drinks, soaps and other items. María has good payment references and is very responsible. She feels very grateful for the help and is certain she will be able to pay off the loan while at the same time give her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, snacks, instant meals, drinks and soaps.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es: María Rosa vive junto a su compañero  de vida y sus tres hijos una familia pequeña pero muy unida; ella se dedica a la  venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, posee en variedad camisas, faldas, vestidos, pantalones entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias; comercia de forma ambulante y desde su hogar, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles, con producto de calidad y con un servicio excelente; María Rosa es una mujer emprendedora y muy dedicada a su labor, siempre esta luchando por lo que desea y no piensa rendirse hasta alcanzar el éxito que se merece, en los últimos meses aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. María Rosa tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: María Rosa lives with her life companion and their three children. It is a small family, but a very close one. She sells clothing for women, men, and children. She sells a variety of shirts, skirts, dresses, and pants, among other things. She has had the business for several years and it has given her a lot of experience, which allows her to obtain greater earnings. She sells as a street vendor and from her home. She has earned herself a lot of clients; people prefer her because she always has what they need at reasonable prices, with quality products and excellent service. María Rosa is an entrepreneurial person and is very dedicated to her work. She is always working for what she wants and she has no thoughts of giving up until she has achieved the success she deserves. In the last few months, demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of that fact to make a new investment. However, she doesn’t have the capital she needs, so that is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy clothing at wholesale price. María Rosa has good payment references and is very responsible. She assures us that she will be able to pay the loan and she also explains that she will bring economic stability to her home.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale price

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, floor tiles, and tools.

loans.name: Dorothy’S Group

texts.en:
Dorothy’s group is one of YICE’s female self-help groups in Kabazungu village, and it is made up of five members all coming from the same village. Dorothy (second from left) is the group leader. Members of this group grow varied crops, including beans, vegetables, Irish potatoes, cassava and onions. Two of the members raise local chickens as well.

Dorothy, 36, grows vegetables, Irish potatoes, and cassava. She has been growing these crops for over the last six years but is getting low yields and income. After acquiring better farming skills through YICE’s farming-as-business training, Dorothy now asks for a loan to purchase good quality vegetable seeds and pesticides and to hire a laborer to clear her garden.

She believes practicing better farming practices will increase her yields and incomes by 70% after selling her produce.

Dorothy plans to use her profits to establish a big piggery project and pay school fees for her three orphaned children. She has a dream of supporting her children’s education up to University level.

loans.use: To purchase good quality vegetable seeds and pesticides and hire staff to clear their gardens

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is a 20-year-old Palestinian married woman, mother of two children. She has been working selling cosmetics and perfumes since 2010.

Salwa is a hard worker who puts a lot of much effort into expanding her business and developing it as much as she can. In the beginning Salwa had financial problems, that's why she started her own business with a financial partner to make sure that her business would cover almost all of her customers' requests.

Today, Salwa is requesting a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to expand her merchandise with special spring cosmetics, and buy her partner's share in the shop, to increase her business income and improve her family's living conditions. She will surely work hard to improve her living and develop her business capital.

loans.use: To expand her merchandise with special spring cosmetics, and buy her partner's share at the shop

loans.name: Zhyan's Group

texts.en:
Zhyan is a 44-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of four children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Zhyan is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Zhyan took and repaid two loans in the past from Relief International Iraq. The first loan she used to buy a small generator allowing her to work even during the hours the city lacks power. And the second she used to improve her work area. Zhyan was featured as a Kiva client a year ago as member of a different group.

Zhyan now has six years experience with the small, home-based sewing and tailoring business activity and is taking a new loan to purchase an over machine (also known as a serger). 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock machine (a serger)

loans.name: Caceritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CASERITAS”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María del Carmen es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: comercio de verduras, comercio de focos, venta de mantillas, venta de pizza, venta de cosméticos, venta de material escolar.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María del Carmen es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pizza; da a conocer que este negocio lo tenía su suegra y ella aprendió a realizar las pizzas con ella, posteriormente le deja el puesto a ella y lo administra ahora.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el apoyo en salud.

Al grupo le acompaña su asesora de crédito Elizabeth, misma que esta vestida de rosado.
texts.en:
The “Caseritas” communal lending group will begin their fourth cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Panamericana regional office. It is composed of 8 members and is led by a board of directors, with María del Carmen as the treasurer. The members run a variety of businesses, including selling vegetables, light bulbs, blankets, pizza, cosmetics, and school supplies. 

The loan they will take out will benefit micro-entrepreneurs, one of whom is María del Carmen. She says that this is her first loan cycle as a member of Pro Mujer. She joined on the invitation of a promoter who went to visit her in her home. She currently has a business selling pizzas. She explains that the business belonged to her mother-in-law and she learned to make pizzas with her. Later, her mother-in-law left the business to her, and she runs it now. 

The loan she will take out now is to increase working capital by purchasing flour in the markets of the city of La Paz and after cooking with it, will sell in her sales space. This work allows her to generate income to support her household as well as possible; she is married and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health support. 

The group is accompanied by their credit counselor, Elizabeth, who is wearing pink.

loans.use: purchase flour to make pizza

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 33-year-old married young man and a father to two sons and one daughter.
For the past year, Ahmad has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and is the only source of income for the family.
Ahmad is requesting a $1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new engine for the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi's capacity to work extra hours and enable Ahmad to take on additional fares, which will improve his family's income.
Ahmad is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wholesale fabric and thread.

loans.name: Michael Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nabaguma est leader du groupe Michael. Elle est entrepreneur très ambitieuse, âgée de 47 ans, mère de 10 enfants. Son mari est un cultivateur. La cliente est vendeuse de denrées alimentaires. Elle expose ses articles à son domicile. Elle démarra son business avec son fonds propre, il ya plus de 11 ans qu’elle fait cette activité. Le défi majeur pour cet entrepreneur est qu’elle vend parfois en crédit. Ce nouveau crédit lui servir d’acheter 1 sac de mais et un basin de tomates, etc. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour le soutien aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en: The client Nabaguma is the leader of the group Michael. She is a very ambitious entrepreneur, 47 years old, and mother to 10 children. Her husband is a farmer. The client sells foodstuffs. She displays her items at her home. She started her business with her own funds. She has been in this business for more than 11 years. The major challenge for this entrepreneur is that she sometimes sells for credit. This new loan will serve to buy her 1 bag of corn and one basin of tomatoes, etc. Thus, she thanks Hekima and its partners for supporting small entrepreneurs who are not bankable. It should be noted that some clients are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy 1 bag of corn and 1 basin of tomatoes, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer to expand his rice production

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 43-year-old married woman. She lives a simple life with her family in Nablus. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is barely enough to cover his needs. Rana is requesting a loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a new refrigerator for her family to use at home. 

Taking this loan will offer Rana and her family better living conditions. Rana is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to buy some necessary home appliances.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some equipment to make Arabian sweets.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercede, de 52 años de edad, casada con tres hijos, es originaria de la Paz Centro lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. La paz Centro se caracteriza por sus comidas típicas como el quesillo y el tiste. Mercedes es una mujer trabajadora responsable que lo ha demostrado en sus créditos anteriores, en el cumplimiento de sus pagos en tiempo y forma.
Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos de limpieza para el hogar, como cloro, detergente, ambientadores, desinfectantes de pisos, Ajax. Actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante y por encargo  a clientes fijos y eventuales. la rutina de trabajo de Mercedes es de unas 10 horas. Actividad que la disfruta con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos de la limpieza del hogar. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Mercedes agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 52, is married and has three children.  She is from La Paz Centro, which is located in the western part of the country.  The city is known for its regional food, such as "quesillo" (mozarella-type cheese) and "tiste" (a cocoa-corn drink).  Mercedes is a hard-working, responsible woman who has paid off her previous loans on time.

Thanks to her spirit and determination to get ahead, she is now selling home cleaning products such as bleach, detergent, air freshener, floor cleaners, and Ajax.  She works from home and door-to-door, taking orders from fixed and eventual customers.  Mercedes works about ten hours a day and enjoys what she does.  The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital to buy cleaning products.  This is so she can increase her income in the near future.

Mercedes is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping low-income families in poor countries such as Nicaragua to earn a decent living.

loans.use: To buy home cleaning products.

loans.name: Jessica Brendaly

texts.es: Jessica Brendaly vive junto a su compañero de vida Romeo y su hija, en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para niñas y niños, camisas, pantalones, vestidos, faldas entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su vivienda y también comercia de forma ambulante, es muy conocida por las personas del lugar, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues todos saben que  lo que vende es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al alcance de los clientes; Jessica es una mujer comprometida, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora día con día se esfuerza al máximo para ganarse una vida mejor y un gran éxito para el futuro, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde ya que todas sus compras son al contado por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Jessica Brendaly tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable se siente agradecida con la ayuda, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Jessica Brendaly lives with her common-law husband, Romeo, and their daughter in their own house.  She sells children's clothing, shirts, pants, dresses and skirts and has been in business for several years.  This has given her a lot of experience which has allowed her to earn a good income.  She works from home and also as a street peddlar.  She is well-known in the area and has many customers who are familiar with her quality, low prices and unequaled customer service.  

Jessica is a committed, dedicated worker who struggles every day to earn a better living and become successful in the future.  Over the last few weeks, demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of the moment and make a new investment.  Since she does not have enough capital to pay for her purchases in cash, she is requesitng a loan through INTEGRAL to buy clothing wholesale.  

Jessica Brendaly has a good credit record and irreproachable moral code.  She is very grateful for the help and committed to paying back the loan on time.  She is hopeful she can provide her household with economic stability.

loans.use: To buy clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Gladys Haydee

texts.es: Gladys Haydee vive junto a su compañero de vida Sergio y sus hijos, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad frijoles, arroz, pan, leche, huevos, azúcar, jabones entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le  permite obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, es muy conocida en la localidad la gente la recomienda porque su tienda es muy surtida siempre tiene lo que la gente necesita a precios accesibles, con producto de calidad y un servicio excelente; Gladys es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica, y muy motivada a salir adelante, le gusta luchar por sus sueños sabe que si se esfuerza al máximo lograra lo que se propone y tendrá mucho éxito en su vida. Como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, producto instantáneo, bebidas, jabones, etc. Gladys Haydee tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, tiene la certeza que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía en que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Gladys Haydee lives with her common-law husband, Sergio, and their children.  She has a store where she sells staple goods, such as beans, rice, bread, milk, eggs, sugar, soaps, etc.  For several years she has been in business and this has given her a good amount of sales experience which allows her to constantly earn more income.  She is very well-known in her town and people recommend her store because of its variety, low prices, good quality and excellent service.

Gladys is dedicated to her work, energetic and very motivated to get ahead.  She enjoys striving to reach her goals and knows that if she works as hard as she can she will be very successful in life.  Like any good merchant, she wants to expand her business and make a new investment.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy staple goods, sweets, bread, instant products, beverages, soaps, etc.  

Gladys Haydee has a good credit record and irreproachable moral code.  She is committed to paying back the loan, and is confident she can provide her household with economic stability.

loans.use: To buy staple goods, sweets, bread, instant products, beverages and soaps.

loans.name: Mirian Guadalupe

texts.es: Miriam Guadalupe vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida rápida tortas, panes, bebidas, entre otras, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia valiosa en la cocina, comercia desde su carro móvil en un lugar que califico como excelente para sus actividades comerciales se ha hecho de mucha clientela fija que la prefiere porque elabora la comida mas exquisita de la zona, con material de primera calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un servicio excelente; Miriam es una mujer entregada a su labor, luchadora, ama su labor y sabe que eso le ayudara a alcanzar el éxito por eso todos los días se esfuerza al máximo por superarse, su comedor es de los mas conocidos tiene mucha demanda por eso quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión y le ha solicitado a INTGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar pan, jamón, carne, verduras, bebidas, etc. Miriam Guadalupe  tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza de ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mirian Guadalupe lives with her common-law husband and children.  She sells fast food such as cakes, breads, beverages, etc., and has been in business for several years.  This has given her a lot of valuable cooking experience.  She has a food cart that she places in an excellent location and has many fixed customers who prefer her food because it is the most exquisite in the area.  She uses top quality ingredients and offers low prices and excellent service.

Mirian is dedicated to her work and loves her job.  She knows this will help her become successful, so she works as hard as she can every day to get ahead.  Her food stall is very well-known and has a high demand, so she wants to make a new investment.  She has requested a loan through INTEGRAL to buy bread, ham, meat, vegetables, beverages, etc.

Mirian Guadalupe has a good credit record and is committed to paying back the loan.  She is hopeful she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy bread, ham, meat, vegetables and beverages.

loans.name: Somaly's Group

texts.en: A resident from the Kandal Stoeng district in the Kandal province, Somaly is 33 years old and married. She is blessed with three children who are still in school. To support the daily cost of living, she grows rice whereas her husband works at a construction site. Through her current business, Somaly is able to earn nearly $2.50 per day. This is the first loan for Somaly with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. Somaly is the leader of a group consisting of two other members. For the sake of her family's hygienic practices, Somaly has decided to take out a loan with her co-borrowers to buy a latrine. She and her co-borrowers are seeking 160,000 KHR each. As a group leader, Somaly will use her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes to own a latrine for her family's convenience and good sanitary practices.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
Simplicia is 51 years old, married and has five children.  

Simplicia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Simplicia requested an 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her livestock.

Simplicia has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Simplicia would like to save enough money to increase her livestock business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her livestock.

loans.name: Chary

texts.en:
Chary is 43 years old and has three children, of whom one is in school.

Chary is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Chary has been pig fattening for six years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Chary requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of his pig pens and additional feeds for his pigs.

In the future, Chary would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her pig pens and additional feeds.

loans.name: Sovana

texts.en:
Sovana, is 53, and a rural villager from Ponhea Leur district of Kandal Province. He has five children who currently help in his business. Out of this five children, only one child is still in school to pursue a higher education level. As one of the breadwinners of the family, he struggles to make a living with the support of his wife through trading recycled items. This business returns him about 25,000 KHR per day. This income enables him to save up to 10,000 KHR per day after offsetting the necessary expenses. This is the fifth loan for Sovana with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. He has succeeded in paying back his past loans and feels confident that he can improve the standard of living for his family gradually. 

For this new cycle, he is seeking for an education loan to pay for his son’s tuition fees. He hopes that this financial support will help his son to continue his studies until graduation and to offer support for the family.

loans.use: to pay for his son's school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to make bouquets for different occasions.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
This is Renato, 51, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Single, he manages his household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses and help his parents financially.

Renato operates a salon business. He offers hair styling, hair grooming and services of the like. He also offers hair straightening. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. His salon is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies for his salon, like shampoo, hair treatment creams and oils, and other things needed for his business. He expects a boost in his income as he expands his business. 

Renato dreams to have his own place for his salon so he will no longer rent. He hopes to help his siblings. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for beauty products and hair products needed in his salon.

loans.name: Darwin

texts.en:
Darwin, a 38-year-old married father of four, lives in Comunal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, where he has operated a general store to make a living for 10 years, each month earning PHP 15000. A member of PMPC for two years, he has requested a loan of PHP 30000 to purchase more stock to sell such as toothpastes, soaps,shampoos, etc. 

In the future, Darwin hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his general store to sell such as toothpastes, soaps, shampoos, etc.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en: Domingas is taking a loan of $1500 to improve her business. She is married and she is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as sleepers, cigarettes, salt, shampoo, oil, bread, coffee, sugar, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $500. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: To buy milk, salt, fish, shampoo, bread, oil, coffee, sugar, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Ma. Editha

texts.en:
Ma. Editha is a 48 year old married woman and a mother of three grown children from Loon, Bohol. She is engaged in the hog raising business and takes orders for grocery items for the people in her area. Purchasing cards are the alternatives of buying groceries without the use of money. She stands as a guarantor for all the purchases made by her clients using the cards and they will pay her in a certain period of time.
Ma. Editha is asking for a loan to add additional capital for her purchasing order cards. 
In the future, Ma. Editha hopes of improving her business and makes it a success.

loans.use: to add as additional capital for her purchasing order cards

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hard-working entrepreneur, who has a food vending business selling "bodbod" (sticky rice wrapped in banana leaves) in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years, and she also earns income by making bags. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Pompia

texts.en: Pompia is a merchant from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a 63-year-old married woman and the mother of four grown up children. Pompia needs a loan. She is requesting a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, soda, cooking seasonings, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and serve more buyers in her store; thus, augmenting her sales and profit. In the future, Pompia hopes to improve her store and make it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, soda, cooking seasonings, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Shodigul

texts.ru: Шодигул замужняя женщина с одним ребенком. Ей 24 года и она проживает в районе Пяндж. Ее муж в данное время находится на заработках в загранице. Шодигул тоже наравне с мужем трудится и обеспечивает семью. Она уже 6 лет как занимается растениеводством и в основном выращивает картошку. Так как сейчас сезон посева, Шодигул запрашивает кредит для посева картофеля. За счет прибыли с урожая она планирует расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Shodigul is a married woman with one child. She is 24 years old and lives in the region of Pyandj. Her husband is working abroad at the moment. Shodigul is also working as her husband and supports the family. She has been cultivating plants, mainly growing potatoes, for already six years. Because the season for sowing is now Shodigul is asking for a loan to sow potatoes. She plans to use the profit from the loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to sow potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Con altos niveles de superación y entrega total a la familia, este joven Es un hombre muy emprendedor que su mayor deseo es entregarle un mejor futuro a su familia, vive con su grupo familiar. Él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol y tiene poco tiempo de dedicarse a la agricultura pues está teniendo un nuevo comienzo alejado de la delincuencia y que le permitirá obtener muy buenas ganancias. Es muy comprometido con sus responsabilidades en su hogar y sobretodo con la ilusión de que su familia le reconozca su labor día a día. Decidió a aumentar la producción pero necesita realizar una nueva inversión por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abonos  herbicida, abono, entre otros. Confía plenamente en que Dios no lo desamparara y está contento con la ayuda y asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda, antes del tiempo previsto.
texts.en:
This young man works hard at self improvement and gives everything to his family. He lives with his family and is a hard worker whose biggest desire is to provide a better future for his family. 

He grows corn and beans. He has been a farmer for a short time, but he is having a new start far from delinquency that will allow him to have better earnings. He is committed to his responsibilities in the home and above all, he hopes that his family will recognize his day to day work. 

He decided to increase production and needs to make a new investment, so he is requesting a loan that would allow him to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and herbicide, among others. He trusts fully in God that He won’t abandon him. He is happy to have the help and assures that he will be able to repay the debt before the anticipated deadline.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and more

loans.name: Mkambe

texts.en:
Mkambe is a 48-year-old woman from Samburu, Kenya. She is married with four children, aged 10, 13, 15 and 17, all of whom are in school. She lives with husband and children in a rental house that has solar power and tap water. She has a retail shop selling brooms, a business she has had for more than two years.
She has requested a loan of KES 40,000 to buy more brooms for resale. She is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy more brooms for resale.

loans.name: Apalon

texts.en:
Apalon is 56 years old. He is married and lives in the Martvili District with his wife and 12 year old son. Apalon requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 
Apalon is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has 2 new tractors, which are used for tilling the agricultural land. Apalon rents his tractors to his villagers and earns income. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 
Apalon requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Apalon will purchase chickens to start a poultry farm. He will place the chickens in a shed located in their yard. He will raise them and sell them for a higher price. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to start a poultry farm.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 42 years old. She lives in the Akhmeta district of East Georgia with her husband, son, daughter and father, who is provided with a retirement pension.
On several occasions Ketevan has requested a loan from local financial institutions for an agricultural business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were always rejected because lack of experience in the business, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. All the family members work hard to improve their living conditions. Ketevan is a worker at the local wine factory and gets a small monthly salary. The family has a plot of land where they grow maize. The crops they harvest are sold locally. Ketevan also has a milk cow, whose milk is used in dairy products. In addition, family members harvest grapes on the family-owned vineyard and produce wine for selling. Ketevan’s husband has a tractor and performs agricultural work on the lands of nearby farmers during tilling season.
Ketevan is now requesting a loan for her agricultural business. The loan program provides businesses with start-up funding to assist the country's rural poor, who do not have access to most credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the loan proceeds, Ketevan would like to purchase a fertilizer spreader. They will install it on the tractor and Ketevan’s husband will be able to serve the local people during fertilizing season as well. He will offer the services to landlords from his village and hopes that the project will be profitable as there is not a tractor with the same equipment in their village. The farmers will pay a service fee and this will significantly increase their family's income and will enable Ketevan to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a fertilizer spreader for her tractor.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Todas las personas merecen segundas oportunidades y esta joven no es la excepción, superandose así mismo y alejada de malas amistades, ahora es una mujer muy responsable, honesta y sincera que jamás se ha dejado vencer por las adversidades de la vida y ha querido siempre lo mejor para ella y su familia.  La joven se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y vende todo lo que los dos cerdos que posee le brindan, es muy emprendedora y aprovecha la experiencia que su padre posee en ésta actividad. La clienta desea tener mas ingresos para seguirle brindando lo mejor a su familia es por eso que solicita un crédito que le permita comprar un cerdo más para seguir brindando una buena y mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Desea de todo corazón que le brinden apoyo y confía que pronto seguirá dándole una mejor calidad de vida a su familia
texts.en:
Everybody deserves a second chance and this young lady is not an exception. She has overcome difficulties and fled from bad influences around her. Now, she is a responsible, honest and sincere woman that has never let adversity defeat her in life and that has always hoped for the best for her and her family.

This young lady raises pigs and sells everything they produce. She has an entrepreneurial spirit and makes the most out of her father’s experience in this activity. She would like to have a better income in order to continue giving her family the best. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy a pig and continue providing her family with a better quality of life.

She hopes with all her heart to receive this support and feels confident that soon, she will be able to continue giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a pig and continue improving her family's quality of life.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is 21 years old and from Sevqar village. He lives with parents and sister Meline. Meline studies Armenian Philology (study of language in written historical sources) at Yerevan State University in Ljevan. Edgar and his parents work hard to sustain the family and cover their basic needs. It is very difficult for them to save money for Meline's education. So Edgar has applied for this loan to pay for his sister's university tuition. It is very important for him to give an opportunity to Meline to complete her education. Meline is a very hardworking young lady, and hopes that she will be able to complete her education.

loans.use: to pay for his sister's university tuition.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 22-year-old, entrepreneurial, married woman. She has three years of experience in selling women's clothes, thanks to her father who taught her a lot about managing the business.
She has requested a loan of KES 25,000 to buy bundles of clothes. She is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes.

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
Ramin is 59 years old. He is married and lives in the Martvili District with his wife and 12 year old son. Ramin requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 
Ramin is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has 2 milk cows and a pig. Besides, he has 500 nut trees and a vineyard with 200 vine trees. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 
Ramin requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Ramin will purchase chickens to start a poultry farm. He will place the chickens in a shed located in their yard. He will raise them and sell them for a higher price. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to start a poultry farm.

loans.name: Daysi Aracely

texts.es: Daysi Aracely vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo en casa propia, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de hamacas, de muchos diseños que ella misma crea, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en la venta que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, su negocio esta ubicado en su vivienda y es muy conocido por las personas de la comunidad donde viven,  tiene mucha clientela y la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos  precios y sobre todo por  un buen servicio; Daysi es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a  su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños ,  todos los días trabaja duro para poder alcanzar el éxito y no piensa rendirse hasta lograrlo, quiere acrecentar el negocio y para ello necesita de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar hilos por mayor, cuerda, etc. Daysi Aracely tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y  la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Daysi Aracely lives together with her life partner and their son in their own home. She makes and sells hammocks of all different designs that she creates herself. She has run this business for several years, accumulating a lot of experience in sales that allows her to make the best earnings possible. Her business is located in her home and is well known by the people of the community where she lives. She has a lot of customers who prefer her because of the high quality and good prices of the hammocks, but above all, because of Daysi's good service. 

Daysi is a very entrepreneurial woman dedicated to her work. She has a strong drive to get ahead and achieve her dreams. She works hard every day to be able to achieve success and does not consider giving up until she achieves her goals. 

Daysi wants to expand her business. In order to do so, she needs working capital to back her up, which is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL. The loan would allow her to purchase wholesale thread, cord, etc. Daysi Aracely has a good credit record and irreproachable morals. She guarantees that she will be able to pay off the debt and at the same time, is confident that she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: invest in wholesale thread and cord

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar vive junto a su compañera de vida Rosa y sus dos hijas en casa propia; el posee un taller de carpintería elabora mesas, sillas, bancos, entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia valiosa en su trabajo y le ha traído muy buenas ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su vivienda en una localidad muy transitada de personas, es muy conocido por su excelente labor y se ha hecho de mucha clientela fija que lo prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesita a precios realmente accesibles,  además de la calidad y el buen servicio; Julio es un hombre ejemplar, decidido y dedicado a su labor le gusta luchar por lo que desea y quiere un futuro mejor por eso se esfuerza al máximo para alcanzar el éxito que se merece, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y no posee de materia prima, necesita realizar una nueva inversión para no decepcionar a sus clientes por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar madera, pegamento, clavos, etc. Julio Cesar tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que cancela en el periodo establecido y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar lives with his life partner Rosa and their two daughters in their own home. He has a carpentry workshop where he makes tables, chairs, benches, and more. He has worked in this business for several years. He has gained valuable work experiences and has brought in a good profit. The business is located in his home in an area busy with a lot of people. He is known for his excellent work and has accumulated many regular customers. They always prefer him not only because he always has what they need at accessible prices, but also because of the good quality and service. 

Julio is an exemplary man, resolute and dedicated to his work. He likes fighting for what he wants and aspires to a better future. Thus, he works as hard as he can to achieve the success that he deserves. 

In the past few weeks, demand has gone up, but he does not have the raw materials. He needs to make a new investment so as not to disappoint his customers. He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that would allow him to purchase wood, glue, nails, etc. 

Julio Cesar has a good credit record and irreproachable morals. He guarantees that he will pay off the loan in the established time period, and at the same time, he hopes that he will bring economic security to his home.

loans.use: purchase wood, glue, and nails

loans.name: Maanga Group

texts.fr:
Mme HABIBOU est la représentante du groupe MAANGA. Habibou se porte très bien. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 18ans le moins âgé a 07ans. Maintenant, tous ses enfants  vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes à sa charge.
Mme vend des pagnes  et plats  depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché du secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les amis et les voisins.
Mme veut  s’acheter  20 complets pagnes  et 30 complets de plats.
Elle  épargne ses bénéfices afin  d’aider à la scolarisation des enfants. Mme ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique pour son activité et participer à la construction d’une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Habibou is the representative of the Maanga group and is very well. She is married and mother to four children, the eldest of whom is 18 years old and the youngest seven. All her children go to school now and she has four dependents. 

She has been selling "pagnes" and flatware for the past seven years. She gets her supplies from the Sector 10 market in town and her customers are friends and neighbors. She would like to buy 20 sets of pagnes and 30 sets of flatware. 

She saves her profits so that she can help with the children's education. Her ambition is to open a large shop for her business and contribute to the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy 20 sets of "pagnes" and 30 sets of flatware.

loans.name: L'aenir Group

texts.fr:
Mme AISSATOU représente le groupe L’AENIR. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. Tous vont à l’école et elle a une (01) personne en charge.
 Mme vend des produits de beauté, des objets plastiques et fait aussi la coiffure depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés locaux. Ses clients sont les femmes, hommes et son entourage.
 Elle veut s’acheter 05 douzaines de tissage, 45 seaux, 25 bassine et 05 carton de pommades toutes sortes. 
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne toujours améliorer son activité, aider son mari à assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et s’acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Aissatou represents the Aenir group and is doing very well. She is married and mother to three children, the eldest of whom is 13 years old and the youngest six. All of the children go to school and she has one dependent. 

She has been selling beauty products, plastic objects and also been hairdressing for the past eleven years. She gets her supplies in a local market. Her customers are women, men and her circle of friends.

She would like to buy five dozen hair weaves, 45 buckets, 25 bowls and five cartons of all sorts of creams. 

She wants to save her profits and her ambition is to continue to improve her business, help her husband to provide for her children's education and to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy five dozen hair weaves, 45 buckets, 25 bowls and five cartons of all sorts of creams.

loans.name: Cornel

texts.en:
Cornel is 43 years old, married and has three children. She operates a beauty salon. She has been in business for the past ten years. She used her previous loan to add a student classroom. Her business did well and she successfully repaid her loan. She is very hardworking and determined. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, her business has grown tremendously and she has bought salon equipment.

She hopes to grow her profit margins and educate her children up to the university level. She requires a loan of 30,213 KES to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Chigunda's Group

texts.en:
Chigunda is a thirty-six-year old mother of five children and a dry-land farmer. She grows maize, cowpeas and cassava. Chigunda's agricultural business faces the challenges of unreliable rainfall and lack of capital to buy pesticides.

She is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because she believes KOMAZA is helping to empower farmers with knowledge and skills. With the profits from her tree farm, Chigunda plans to educate her children and open a warehousing business.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
Ramin is 26 years old. He is unmarried and lives in Batumi city with his parents. Ramin’s mother is a teacher at the public school and his father is involved in a meat-trading business.

The main income for Ramin is his newly-started grocery store, selling different types of groceries. As he has recently opened it, the store needs more support to further develop. Ramin’s loan request was approved as part of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-ups and re-startups with credit with soft conditions to the rural poor who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With the received credit, Ramin will cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request. He plans to increase the turnover in his trade business gradually. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Ramin will work hard, and he will be able to improve the living conditions for his family. With this loan, his family will generate enough income to access regular available credit products in the country’s capital market in the event that they need it.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of groceries for his newly-started store

loans.name: Furaha's Group

texts.en:
Furaha is a thirty-four-year old mother of seven and a dry land farmer. She grows maize, cowpeas and cassava. Furaha does not have enough money to buy seeds to plant and insecticides when the crops are affected by pests, resulting in low yields.

She is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because she knows that in the future she will make profits from the sale of trees. "The profits I will make will enable me to send my kids to a good school to get an education," she says.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot lives in Vanadzor town with his wife and son Davit (in the photo), who is a student. Davit studies at "Yerevan State Medical University after Mkhitar Heratsi", in the department of general medicine. 

Ashot works as a coordinator at one of the local companies, but his monthly salary is hardly enough for covering the family's daily costs. It is very difficult for him to save money for his son's education, so he has applied for this loan to pay Davit's university tuition.

The loan is very important for Ashot to give his son an opportunity to complete his education and become a good specialist.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Nare

texts.en:
Nare is from Artashat town; she lives with her parents and brother. She owns a little shop where she sells clothing.  

Nare studies at Yerevan Haybusak University, in the medical department. She works hard to sustain her family, as well as cover her education costs. Unfortunately, her monthly income is hardly enough to cover daily costs, and it is very difficult for Nare to save money for tuition. 

She has applied for this loan to pay for her university tuition and complete her education.

She dreams of becoming a good specialist and helping people.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is one of Esperanza International's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza International almost seven years ago for a loan to expand her grocery store. She joined the group "Dios es mi Pastor - God is my Shepherd" in one of the rural villages in San Pedro de Macoris, where she has received loans to invest in her business. 

Marie is a mother with three children that she is raising by herself and with her long term partner. She lives in a small slum community in San Pedro de Macoris. She is receiving her 10th loan from Esperanza. She is accessing this loan to start building her home. She has been building her house little by little, and the purpose of this loan is especially to build and raise some walls, because previously she had only built the foundations of the house. 

Marie will invest this loan by purchasing cement, concrete blocks, sand and other construction materials. Esperanza Internacional is running a program where most of their clients pay back their loans, fulfill their commitment to expand their businesses, and show fidelity to their groups. They can request loans to improve their house structure while receiving business loans and attending group meetings.

loans.use: To purchase concrete blocks, cement, etc.

loans.name: Narek

texts.en:
Narek is from Ijevan town, where he lives with his wife and two children. He is 28 years old and works at a local company. His wife, Narine, studies at Yerevan State University, with the pedagogical (education) faculty. 

Narek is a lovely father and husband who works hard to sustain his family and pay for his wife's education.  As his monthly income is hardly enough to cover the family's daily costs, it is very difficult for Narek to save money for Narine's education.

Narek has applied for this loan to pay for his wife's university tuition. The loan is very important for Narek and his wife in order for her to complete her education and become a good specialist.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition for his wife.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is a student at Yerevan State Medical University, which is named after Mkhitar Heratsi, the father of Armenian medicine. She lives with her mother and brother, who is 18.

Along with school, Hasmik also works at a local pharmacy. Her monthly income is hardly enough to cover the family's daily costs, because Hasmik is the only worker in the family. 

That's why it is very difficult for Hasmik to save money for her education. She has applied for this loan to pay for her university tuition. 

It is very important for Hasmik to complete her education, and be able to ensure a better life for her mother and her brother.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Rosa Alba De La Cruz

texts.es: Rosa Alba vive junto a su compañero de vida José y su  hija, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de semillas, de marañón, pepitoria y maní, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy concurrido de personas lo realiza de forma ambulante y desde su hogar, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es delicioso, a buen precio, de calidad y  con un excelente servicio; Rosa es una mujer comprometida, joven y dedicada a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde ya que sus compras son al contado por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de marañón que ha estado un poco escasa, pepitoria y maní. Rosa Alba tiene buenas referencias de pago es responsable y esta agradecida con la colaboración, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Rosa Alba lives with her life partner José and her daughter.  She makes a living buying and selling cashew, pumpkin, and peanut seeds.

She has had the business for several years, which has given her a lot of experience so she can get the best profits.  The place where she sells is crowded with people.  She does her job as a street vendor and from home because she has a lot of customers who prefer her for her delicious and quality product, good price, and excellent service.

Rosa's a committed young woman who is dedicated to her job and very much wants to get ahead.  She's always looking for ways to achieve success.  Demand has increased in the past few weeks and she wants to take advantage of it to make a new investment, but she doesn't have enough capital to support this because her sales are in cash.

This is why she's asking Integral for a loan to buy cashew seeds, which have been a little scarce, pumpkin seeds, and peanuts.

Rosa Alba has a good payment record and is responsible.  She's grateful for the contribution and is certain she'll be able to repay the debt.  She's also confident that she'll give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy cashew, peanut, and pumpkin seeds

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 47 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, which she has done for the last six years.  Anita is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melva works hard to support her family. Melva is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years now.

Melva requested a loan of 21000 PHP through NWTF to buy stocks of items like soap, candies, sugar, and milk to sell.

In the future, Melva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of items like soap, candies, sugar, and milk to sell.

loans.name: Ena

texts.en:
This loan will help Ena build her daycare center.

After moving from Honduras to New York, Ena was looking for a means to begin her own business and support her daughter. In 2010, Ena opened her own daycare center in the Bronx. She now has seven children from the ages of 1 to 10 years old enrolled in her program, and she operates her daycare full-time, five days a week, with the help of a part-time employee.  

Ena is now looking to renovate her space to attract more clients and grow her business.

Ena needs a loan to purchase toys, furniture, carpet and paint to remodel her daycare center.

loans.use: To purchase toys, furniture, carpet and paint for her daycare.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Mildred works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from running a general store and raising pigs. Mildred is borrowing 24000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery business.

Mildred has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell corn business in the Philippines. Janet has been in this business for 9 years. Janet earns more income from food vending and farming corn.

She is borrowing 10000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of corn for her business to sell.

Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of corn to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 34 years old and married with two children. Analyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 30000 PHP through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soap, canned goods, sugar, noodles, and spices.

Analyn has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Analyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soap, canned goods, sugar, noodles, and spices.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace, a 27-year-old married mother of two, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for two years to earn a living. She earns an additional income by selling charcoal.

Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ailen

texts.en:
Ailen is 50 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ailen has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Ailen requested a 15000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Ailen has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Ailen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. Melanie has been in this business for 8 years and earns more income from vegetable vending and raising pigs.

She is borrowing 28000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock of items to sell like soap, milk, noodles, and canned goods for her general store business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of items to sell like soap, milk, noodles, and canned goods.

loans.name: Jen-Jen

texts.en:
Jen-Jen is 24 years old and married with one child, who is in school. Jen-Jen works very hard to provide for her family.

Jen-Jen runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 4 years. She requested a 20000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, coffee, canned goods, and soap.

In the future, Jen-Jen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, coffee, canned goods, and soap.

loans.name: Ma. Emily

texts.en:
Ma. Emily, a 31-year-old married mother of two children, one of whom is in school, has been raising pigs for fattening in the Philippines for five years now. Having received four previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business, Ma. Emily has requested a new one for PHP 10000 to purchase feeds and additional piglets to raise.

In the future, Ma. Emily would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Susanita

texts.en:
Susanita works hard to support her family. Susanita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Susanita has been in this business for 15 years now.

Susanita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soft drinks, noodles, eggs, spices, canned goods, etc.

In the future, Susanita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soft drinks, noodles, eggs, spices, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 51 years old, married and has four children. 

She raises hogs as a source of income. She has been in this business for over five years and it is a great help to her family's living situation. 

Fely wishes to care for more pigs and raise healthy and meaty hogs in order to achieve greater income. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy vitamins, feed and two more pigs. These would be a help in attaining good proceeds.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, feed and two more pigs.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. Imelda is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Imelda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Imelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Gladis Guadalupe

texts.es: Gladis Guadalupe vive junto a sus hijas en casa propia, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad pan, frijoles, arroz, huevos, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha dado mucha experiencia en las ventas por lo que siempre obtiene las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado a su residencia en una zona muy transitado de personas y muy estratégico, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, la prefieren porque todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un excelente servicio; Gladis es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante todos los días se dedica al máximo a su labor porque sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito, como toda buena comerciante quiere extender el negocio y para ello necesita realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, producto instantáneo, bebidas etc. Gladis Guadalupe tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le podrá dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gladis Guadalupe lives with her children in her own house.  She has a store where she sells basic necessities: bread, beans, rice, eggs, and others.  She has had the business for several years and it has given her a lot of experience in sales, so she always gets the best profits.

Her business is located in her house in a strategic area with a lot of people.  She has acquired a lot of customers who prefer her because everything she sells is of high quality at affordable prices, and her service is excellent.

Gladis is an enterprising woman with a great desire to get ahead.  Every day she makes the maximum effort in her work because she knows that only this way will she achieve success.  Like all good merchants she wants to expand her business, for which she needs to make a new investment.

This is why she's requesting a loan from Integral to buy basic grains, sweets, instant food products, beverages, etc.

Gladis Guadalupe has a good payment record and is very responsible.  She's certain she'll be able to repay the debt and trusts she'll be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, instant food products, and beverages

loans.name: Odilia

texts.es: Odilia vive junto a su pequeña familia en casa propia; ella posee una venta de misceláneos, toda clase de artículos, bolsones, carteras, dulces, loncheras, bisutería entre otros, tiene varios años con el  negocio, esta ubicado en una zona que califico como excelente para su actividad comercial y se siente muy satisfecha al ver que las personas se van contentas del lugar, todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente, Odilia es una mujer visionaria con muchas ganas de ganarse un futuro más próspero,  para ella no hay peor lucha que la que no se pelea, esta dispuesta a dar todo de su parte para siempre mantenerse delante de su competencia y además para tener la posibilidad de acrecentar el negocio para ello necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar  bolsones, carteras, loncheras, dulces, etc.  Odilia es muy comprometida y con un buen record crediticio tiene confianza que podrá saldar la deuda pero sobre todo tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida como se la merecen.
texts.en:
Odilia lives with her small family in her own house.  She has a business selling all types of miscellaneous items.  She sells things like purses, wallets, sweets, lunch sacks, and costume jewelry, among others.  She has had the business for several years.  She is located in an area that is excellent for commercial activity.  She feels very pleased upon seeing that the people leave her place feeling happy.

Everything that she sells is first quality and at affordable prices.  Also, her service is excellent.  Odilia is a visionary woman with a great desire to obtain a more prosperous future.  To her there is not a worse struggle than the one that you do not fight.  She is prepared to give everything in order to always stay ahead of the competition.  She will also do so in order to have the chance to grow the business.  She needs capital to do this.

That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral.  The loan will allow her to buy purses, wallets, lunch sacks, and sweets, etc.  Odilia is very committed and has a good credit record.  She is confident that she will be able to repay the debt.  Above all, she has faith that she will be able to give her family a better quality of life like they deserve.

loans.use: to buy purses, wallets, lunch sacks, and sweets, etc.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 53 years old and married with two children.

Loida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, soap, soft drinks, sugar, and other items to sell. 

Loida has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income as a  rice retailer and pig raiser.

Loida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, soap, soft drinks, sugar, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 52 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 18000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items like soap, shampoo, milk, canned goods, and other items to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase items like soap, shampoo, milk, canned goods, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Marynen

texts.en:
Marynen is 37 years old, married, and has four children. 

She sells a variety of goods at her small stand. Sometimes she walks door to door in order to sell easier. 

Now, Marynen wishes to increase her sales every day. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more goods such as vegetables, spices, sweets and snack foods to resell. She hopes that these additional products will bring additional profits.

loans.use: to buy more goods such as vegetables, spices, sweets and snack foods.

loans.name: Chinbat

texts.en:
Chinbat, 27 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) in Chinbat's brother’s yard.

From 2005 to 2010, Chinbat worked at a car wash, and in 2010 he won the organization's contest and was awarded an automobile, after which he began a taxi service for local people. He is now requesting a loan of 1500000 MNT to prepare for the upcoming Mongolian traditional holiday known as White Moon by purchasing furniture, repairing his car and covering the costs of holiday expenses. Because White Moon symbolizes the beginning of New Year, replacing old furniture and repairing his car are outward signs of a new beginning.

Chinbat is a very earnest individual who works with great sincerity. His near-future goal is to own land and build his own house.

loans.use: to cover the costs related to the White Moon holiday.

loans.name: Bishrelt

texts.en:
Mr. Bishrelt, 27 years old, lives with his mother and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since the time of his divorce, he has been living in a rental house.

Bishreit has been rendering a taxi service to local people since 2006, and has accumulated vast experience in this service field. He is now requesting a loan of 1500000 MNT to cover the cost of repainting his car and purchasing furniture.

For the incoming traditional Mongolian holiday known as White Moon, every Mongolian renews something as a symbol of a new beginning and the anticipation of favorable events in the upcoming year. As well, a fully repainted automobile will certainly increase customer satisfaction. Also, new furniture will decorate his house.

Bishreit is a very hardworking individual who cares deeply for his son and mother.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and paint his automobile.

loans.name: Marina Estela

texts.es: Marina Estela vive junto a su compañero de vida en casa propia, élla posee un pequeño taller de costura donde elabora diferentes prendas al gusto del cliente camisas, vestidos faldas entre otros además elabora mosquiteros de diferentes colores, tiene mas de seis años de experiencia en el negocio y eso le ha dado la oportunidad de obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar que califico como bueno para su trabajo ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque tiene las mejores prendas,  los mejores precios, y el servicio excelente; Marina es una mujer entregada a su labor, comprometida y dispuesta a dar todo de su parte para cumplir sus objetivos propuestos, su mas grande secreto es el amor a su trabajo, sabe que así alcanzara el éxito, necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tela por mayor para ropa y mosquiteros, hilos etc. Marina tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda, esta agradecida con el apoyo y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marina Estela lives with her life partner in her own house.  She has a small tailor shop where she makes different garments for customers: shirts, dresses, skirts, and others.  She also makes mosquito nets in various colors.

She has more than six years of experience in the business, which has given her the opportunity to always get the best profits.  Her business is located in a place she described as good for her job because she has a lot of customers.  People prefer her because she has the best garments, the best prices, and excellent service.

Marina's a woman who is dedicated to her job, committed, and ready to give everything to achieve her goals.  Her biggest secret is her love for her job.  She knows that this way she'll achieve success.

She needs to invest but doesn't have enough capital, so she's asking Integral for a loan to buy fabric wholesale (for clothing and mosquito nets), thread, etc.

Marina has a good payment record and takes responsibility for repaying the debt.  She's grateful for the support and also hopes she'll be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy video games and electronic equipment, etc.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 48 years old. She raises livestock such as chickens, ducks and hogs as a source of income. She has been in this business for more than two years and she looks forward to many more years. 

Fely is pursuing her dream to secure a better lifestyle. To help her overcome poverty, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vitamins. This will enable her to earn additional profits soon.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Sergelenkhuu

texts.en:
Mr. Sergelenkhuu, 34 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land.
